author: smorgan
title: Bayern Munich join Chelsea and Arsenal in the fight to sign Torino hotshot Andrea Belotti

organizations.name: bayern munich related stories team news millwall

text:
Give me a Bel Bayern Munich join Chelsea and Arsenal in the fight to sign Torino hotshot Andrea Belotti 
The 23-year-old striker is reported to have a massive £86million release clause but that won't detract admirers By Sam Morgan Comments BAYERN MUNICH have joined Chelsea and Arsenal in the fight to sign Torino striker Andrea Belotti. 
The 23-year-old Italian has a massive £86million release clause – but that hasn’t stopped him catching the eye of Antonio Conte and Co. EPA 4 Andrea Belotti has reportedly already made contact with Bayern Munich over a move 
Premier League clubs will face an uphill battle, though, as Belotti has reportedly already made contact with Bundesliga champions Bayern Munich. 
Belotti has bagged 17 league goals in just 20 starts this season – including a brace in the 5-3 win over Pescara on the weekend. EPA Andrea Belotti scored a double in the 5-3 win over Pescara EPA The Italy international has proved himself in front of goal and attracted admirers in the Premier League EPA Carlo Ancelotti looks in pole position to sign the Torino striker Wenger says Arsenal lost organisation in 5-1 beating by Bayern Munich Related stories Team News Millwall vs Leicester City team news: Leicester to rest big guns with one eye on the Champions League MAKE YOUR MIND UP Arsene Wenger must decide his Arsenal future immediately for the good of the club, says Jens Lehmann 'like a testimonial' Former Manchester UInited skipper Roy Keane blasts Paul Pogba for making club's clash with St Etienne 'like a testimonial' despite the Red Devils winning 3-0 gunner go Arsenal reportedly draw up shortlist of replacements for Arsene Wenger who could announce future in March ARSENE SPEAKS Arsene Wenger press conference live: Gunners boss set to answer tough questions over his Arsenal future LINDELOF IN THE BAG Man United have secured a pre-contract agreement with Benfica defender Victor Lindelof i'M JUR MAN Chelsea wonderkid Dominic Solanke is ready to join Liverpool in a stunning summer switch Fight club Alexis Sanchez set to quit Arsenal in the summer following dressing room bust up after Bayern Munich defeat I'M IN THE MONEY Former Arsenal and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra is heading to the Chinese Super League CLATT'S CHINA SNUB Mark Clattenburg turned down £1m-a-year offer from China before quitting Prem for Saudi Arabia RED AND BLUE ALERT Manchester City to ramp up security by making Etihad BOMBPROOF over fears of terrors attack Suspicious Minds New Striker: Monty's feeling the heat at the F.A... 
Arsenal - who face doubts over the future of Alexis Sanchez - have also sent scouts to watch Belotti, along with representatives from Manchester United. 
But they may have to break the bank to secure his signature, especially as Bayern appear in the driving seat to sign him.
